wikipedia_page.main:
William McColl (c. 1865 – 20 August 1903) was a Scottish professional footballer, who played as an inside forward for several English and Scottish clubs. He played one match for the Scotland national football team, in a 2–2 draw with Wales on 23 March 1895.
He was the grandfather of Ian McColl, who was also capped by Scotland and later managed the national team.
